head.title: Treasury Auctions Scheduled for This Week

hedline.hl1: Treasury Auctions Scheduled for This Week

block.p: The Treasury's schedule of financing this week includes today's regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills tomorrow.

At the close of the New York cash market on Friday, the rate on the outstanding three-month bill was 5.03 percent. The rate on the six-month issue was 5.09 percent, and the rate on the four-week issue was 5.08 percent.
The Treasury's schedule of financing this week includes today's regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills tomorrow.

At the close of the New York cash market on Friday, the rate on the outstanding three-month bill was 5.03 percent. The rate on the six-month issue was 5.09 percent, and the rate on the four-week issue was 5.08 percent.
The following tax-exempt fixed-income issues are scheduled for pricing this week:
TODAY
Johnson County, Kan., Unified School District No. 512, $69 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
WEDNESDAY
Virginia Public School Authority, $117.3 million of revenue bonds. Competitive.
THURSDAY
Illinois, $150 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
Memphis, $99.2 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
ONE DAY DURING THE WEEK
Bay County, Fla., School Board, $90 million of certificates of participation debt securities. Citigroup Global Markets.
City of Austin, Tex., $63.5 million of revenue refunding bonds for water and wastewater systems, series 2007. Goldman Sachs.
City of Quincy, Ill., $60.8 million of revenue refunding bonds. Banc of America Securities.
City of Reno, Nev., $120 million of debt securities for Renown Health System. Merrill Lynch.
City of Wilmington, Del., $55.2 million of general obligation bonds, series 2007A. PNC Capital Markets.
Dutchess County, N.Y., Industrial Development Agency, $134.7 million of Bard College civic facility revenue bonds, series 2007. Goldman Sachs.
Health, Educational and Housing Facility Board of Knox County, Tenn., $231.6 million of revenue bonds series 2007. Morgan Stanley.
Illinois Housing Development Agency, $65 million of debt securities. UBS Securities.
Lake County, Fla., $70 million of sales tax revenue bonds, series 2007. First Southwest Company.
Lake County, Fla., $86 million of capital improvement debt securities. Citigroup Global Markets.
Massachusetts Housing, $60.5 million of single-family mortgage revenue bonds. UBS Securities.
Michigan State Hospital Finance Authority, $105 million of debt securities for the Oakwood Obligated Group. Bear Stearns.
Riverside County, Calif., Redevelopment Agency, $89 million of debt securities for the Jurupa Valley Redevelopment Agency. Citigroup Global Markets.
Seneca Nation of Indians Capital Improvement Authority, $160 million of debt securities. Merrill Lynch.
South Dakota Health and Education, $75 million of debt securities for Sanford Health. Cain Brothers.
Suffolk, Va., $98 million of general obligation bonds. Citigroup Global Markets.
Tarrant County, Tex., Cultural Education Facilities Finance Corporation, $70 million of retirement facility revenue bonds, series 2007. Ziegler Capital Markets.
Washington State Housing Finance Commission, $55 million of single-family mortgage revenue bonds. UBS Securities.
